page.title: 05LIVESTOCK FARMING IN BRAILES
page.content: Dairying is concentrated on only a few farms with the British Friesian breed predominating although the Canadian Holstein has boosted milk yield in recent years. Milk is sold wholesale and collected in bulk tankers. Beef is produced mainly from Friesian cows crossed with a Hereford bull. Cattle such as Friesian, Hereford cross Friesian, and to an increasing extent Charolais crossbreds are also finished for beef. A large number of sheep of various crosses, mainly north country in origin, are kept. These are mostly crossed with Suffolk rams for fat lamb production. Wool is produced from the breeding sheep. There is a small Texel flock. There are three herds of pigs in the area, Large White the main breed.
